definition: xing-ming, a school of thought of the Warring States period associated with Shen Buhai 申不害[Shen1 Bu4 hai4]/the designation for a punishment
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
xing-ming, a school of thought of the Warring States period associated with Shen Buhai 申不害[Shen1 Bu4 hai4]

sentences.english: Under his rule, the first feature is not yet Xing Ming.
sentences.chinese: 在他的統治之下，第一個特色便是尚刑名。

sentences.english: He punished in accordance with the law, known as the "generation of Xingming phase."
sentences.chinese: 他依法懲處，被稱爲“一代刑名之相”。

sentences.english: Shen Buhai was a representative of the philosophy of the legal school.
sentences.chinese: 申不害是刑名之學的代表人物。

sentences.english: At that time, some names of crime have already devoted to female crime.
sentences.chinese: 當時，已經出現了專門用於女性的刑名。

sentences.english: The names of punishments belong to the law categories.
sentences.chinese: 刑名是一個法學基本概念，亦即刑罰的名稱。

definition: Commandant of Justice in imperial China, one of the Nine Ministers 九卿[jiu3 qing1]
to pass judgment on a legal case
the three judicial chief ministries (in imperial China)
imperial censor (formal title of a dynastic official)
style of governing (of minor official)/achievement in office
same as 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1] Book of History
